description.text: The root directory for all project files.

shortDescription.text: High severity - Credentials are configured via provider attributes

help.text:
The issue is... 
Credentials are configured via provider attributes

 The impact of this is... 
 Use of provider attributes can lead to accidental disclosure of credentials in configuration files, variable definition files, event logs or console logs

 You can resolve this by... 
Set access credentials via environment variables, and remove `access_key` and `secret_key` attributes from the configuration
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Credentials are configured via provider attributes

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Use of provider attributes can lead to accidental disclosure of credentials in configuration files, variable definition files, event logs or console logs

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set access credentials via environment variables, and remove `access_key` and `secret_key` attributes from the configuration

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - IAM password should contain lowercase

help.text:
The issue is... 
Your password does not contain lowercase characters

 The impact of this is... 
 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

 You can resolve this by... 
Set the `require_lowercase` attribute to be `true` to increase the strength of your password
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Your password does not contain lowercase characters

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set the `require_lowercase` attribute to be `true` to increase the strength of your password

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - IAM password should contain symbols

help.text:
The issue is... 
Your password does not contain symbols

 The impact of this is... 
 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

 You can resolve this by... 
Set the `require_symbols` attribute to be `true` to increase the strength of your password

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - IAM password should contain numbers

help.text:
The issue is... 
Your password does not contain numbers

 The impact of this is... 
 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

 You can resolve this by... 
Set the `require_numbers` attribute to be `true` to increase the strength of your password

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - IAM requires minimum password length

help.text:
The issue is... 
Your password does not enforce a minimum length

 The impact of this is... 
 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

 You can resolve this by... 
Set the `minimum_password_length` attribute to be at least `14` to increase the strength of your password
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Your password does not enforce a minimum length

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set the `minimum_password_length` attribute to be at least `14` to increase the strength of your password

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - IAM password should contain uppercase

help.text:
The issue is... 
Your password does not contain uppercase characters

 The impact of this is... 
 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

 You can resolve this by... 
Set the `require_uppercase` attribute to be `true` to increase the strength of your password

 Your password is not following the recommended security practices and is not as strong as it should be

shortDescription.text: Low severity - S3 bucket MFA delete control disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
S3 bucket will not enforce MFA login on delete requests

 The impact of this is... 
 Object could be deleted without stronger MFA authorization

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `versioning.mfa_delete` attribute to `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
S3 bucket will not enforce MFA login on delete requests

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Object could be deleted without stronger MFA authorization

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `versioning.mfa_delete` attribute to `true`

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - RDS IAM authentication is disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
IAM database authentication is disabled, authentication tokens are not used to connect to DB instance

 The impact of this is... 
 Users will connect to DB instance with password, which are less secure than temporary tokens which expire

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `iam_database_authentication_enabled` to `true`.
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
IAM database authentication is disabled, authentication tokens are not used to connect to DB instance

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Users will connect to DB instance with password, which are less secure than temporary tokens which expire

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `iam_database_authentication_enabled` to `true`.

shortDescription.text: High severity - S3 block public ACLs control is disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
Bucket does not prevent creation of public ACLs

 The impact of this is... 
 Anyone who can manage bucket's ACLs will be able to grant public access to the bucket

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `block_public_acls` attribute to `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Bucket does not prevent creation of public ACLs

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Anyone who can manage bucket's ACLs will be able to grant public access to the bucket

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `block_public_acls` attribute to `true`

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - Security Group allows open ingress

help.text:
The issue is... 
That inbound traffic is allowed to a resource from any source instead of a restricted range

 The impact of this is... 
 That potentially everyone can access your resource

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `cidr_block` attribute with a more restrictive IP, for example `192.16.0.0/24`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
That inbound traffic is allowed to a resource from any source instead of a restricted range

 **The impact of this is...** 
 That potentially everyone can access your resource

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `cidr_block` attribute with a more restrictive IP, for example `192.16.0.0/24`

shortDescription.text: Low severity - AWS Security Group allows open egress

help.text:
The issue is... 
The inline security group rule allows open egress

 The impact of this is... 
 Open egress can be used to exfiltrate data to unauthorized destinations, and enable access to potentially malicious resources

 You can resolve this by... 
undefined
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
The inline security group rule allows open egress

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Open egress can be used to exfiltrate data to unauthorized destinations, and enable access to potentially malicious resources

 **You can resolve this by...** 
undefined

shortDescription.text: Low severity - S3 server access logging is disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
The s3 access logs will not be collected

 The impact of this is... 
 There will be no audit trail of access to s3 objects

 You can resolve this by... 
Add `logging` block attribute
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
The s3 access logs will not be collected

 **The impact of this is...** 
 There will be no audit trail of access to s3 objects

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Add `logging` block attribute

shortDescription.text: Low severity - Missing description

help.text:
The issue is... 
The description field is missing in the security group

 The impact of this is... 
 Increases the security management overhead

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `description` attribute to meaningful statement
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
The description field is missing in the security group

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Increases the security management overhead

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `description` attribute to meaningful statement

shortDescription.text: High severity - S3 ignore public ACLs control is disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
Bucket will recognize public ACLs and allow public access

 The impact of this is... 
 If public ACL is attached to the bucket, anyone will be able to read and/or write to the bucket.

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `ignore_public_acls` attribute to `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Bucket will recognize public ACLs and allow public access

 **The impact of this is...** 
 If public ACL is attached to the bucket, anyone will be able to read and/or write to the bucket.

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `ignore_public_acls` attribute to `true`

shortDescription.text: Low severity - S3 bucket versioning disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
S3 bucket versioning is disabled

 The impact of this is... 
 Changes or deletion of objects will not be reversible

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `versioning.enabled` attribute to `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
S3 bucket versioning is disabled

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Changes or deletion of objects will not be reversible

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `versioning.enabled` attribute to `true`

shortDescription.text: High severity - S3 restrict public bucket control is disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
Bucket will recognize public policies and allow public access

 The impact of this is... 
 If public policy is attached to the bucket, anyone will be able to read and/or write to the bucket.

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `restrict_public_buckets` attribute to `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Bucket will recognize public policies and allow public access

 **The impact of this is...** 
 If public policy is attached to the bucket, anyone will be able to read and/or write to the bucket.

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `restrict_public_buckets` attribute to `true`

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - Non-encrypted S3 Bucket

help.text:
The issue is... 
That by default S3 buckets do not encrypt the objects that are stored.

 The impact of this is... 
 That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `server_side_encryption_configuration` block attribute
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
That by default S3 buckets do not encrypt the objects that are stored.

 **The impact of this is...** 
 That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `server_side_encryption_configuration` block attribute

shortDescription.text: High severity - S3 block public policy control is disabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
Bucket does not prevent creation of public policies

 The impact of this is... 
 Anyone who can manage bucket's policies will be able to grant public access to the bucket.

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `block_public_policy` attribute to `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Bucket does not prevent creation of public policies

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Anyone who can manage bucket's policies will be able to grant public access to the bucket.

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `block_public_policy` attribute to `true`

shortDescription.text: Low severity - EC2 API termination protection is not enabled

help.text:
The issue is... 
To prevent instance from being accidentally terminated using Amazon EC2, you can enable termination protection for the instance

 The impact of this is... 
 Without this setting enabled the instances can be terminated by accident. This setting should only be used for instances with high availability requirements. Enabling this may prevent IaC workflows from updating the instance, for example terraform will not be able to terminate the instance to update instance type

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `disable_api_termination` attribute  with value `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
To prevent instance from being accidentally terminated using Amazon EC2, you can enable termination protection for the instance

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Without this setting enabled the instances can be terminated by accident. This setting should only be used for instances with high availability requirements. Enabling this may prevent IaC workflows from updating the instance, for example terraform will not be able to terminate the instance to update instance type

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `disable_api_termination` attribute  with value `true`

shortDescription.text: Low severity - EC2 instance accepts IMDSv1

help.text:
The issue is... 
Instance Metadata Service v2 is not enforced

 The impact of this is... 
 Metadata service may be vulnerable to reverse proxy/open firewall misconfigurations and server side request forgery attacks

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `metadata_options.http_tokens` attribute to `required`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
Instance Metadata Service v2 is not enforced

 **The impact of this is...** 
 Metadata service may be vulnerable to reverse proxy/open firewall misconfigurations and server side request forgery attacks

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `metadata_options.http_tokens` attribute to `required`

shortDescription.text: Medium severity - Non-Encrypted root block device

help.text:
The issue is... 
The root block device for ec2 instance is not encrypted

 The impact of this is... 
 That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.

 You can resolve this by... 
Set `root_block_device.encrypted` attribute to `true`
help.markdown:
**The issue is...** 
The root block device for ec2 instance is not encrypted

 **The impact of this is...** 
 That should someone gain unauthorized access to the data they would be able to read the contents.

 **You can resolve this by...** 
Set `root_block_device.encrypted` attribute to `true`
